results.firPara: Without Wayne Rooney the manager can concentrate on creating a side that recaptures the imagination with a strong team ethic and a game plan
results.secPara: Here we go again. Time to fire up the sirens, unfurl the St George Cross flag and rattle off once more on the charabanc of doomed hope and certain despair. The Gareth Southgate England era has at least been notable for its ability to cut straight to the point. This is already the first England reign to begin rather than simply end with an ashen-faced apology, Southgate spending those first few weeks looking sad and saying sorry for all that stuff with Big Sam, Iceland and pretty much everything else for the last 50 years or so.
results.webTitle: England’s starless Beige Brigade can build again under Gareth Southgate | Barney Ronay

results.firPara: Manchester United will face Real Madrid, Barcelona and Manchester City this summer in the International Champions Cup in the United States.
results.secPara: United start their pre-season tour with two games against Major League Soccer sides, Los Angeles Galaxy on 15 July and Real Salt Lake two days later, before kicking off the ICC tournament against their Manchester rivals on 20 July at a venue yet to be decided.
results.webTitle: Manchester United to face Real Madrid and Barcelona in pre-season US tour

results.firPara: Professional footballers are to be encouraged into a second career in refereeing by an initiative to be set up by the Football Association and the Professional Footballers Association within the next two years.
results.secPara: At present former footballers who try to break into refereeing have no advantage over members of the public with no experience in the game. With the journey from Sunday leagues to Premier League taking at least 10 years, a player who retires in their mid-30s will be approaching 50 and pondering a second retirement before they reach the highest level. Though age limits have been abandoned in recent years the oldest referees currently officiating in the top flight are Neil Swarbrick and Roger East, who are 51.
results.webTitle: FA and PFA outline plan for fast-tracking players to become top referees

results.firPara: Gareth Southgate takes charge of his first match since taking the England job full time insisting he is willing to instigate more challenging conversations and difficult decisions to put together a side capable of ending the cycle of national team disappointment.
results.secPara: Once described as too gentlemanly for top-level management, Southgate has already accelerated the phasing out of Wayne Rooneys international career and telephoned Theo Walcott last week to tell one of the Premier Leagues leading English scorers he was being left out because his England performances had not been up to scratch.
results.webTitle: Gareth Southgate looks to Marcus Rashford and sets bar high for England

results.firPara: Return to Dublin stirs fond memories for the Wales manager once pursued by Jack Charlton but World Cup qualifying points are his priority
results.secPara: When all the drama is over at the Aviva Stadium late on Friday evening, following a World Cup qualifier against the Republic of Ireland that Wales can ill-afford to lose, Chris Coleman will find a quiet moment to enjoy a pint of Guinness and remember his late father, who was born and raised in Dublin and passed away a little more than three years ago.
results.webTitle: Wales’s Chris Coleman plots to sink Ireland in the land of his father

results.firPara: Midfielder Jackson Irvine is making a name for himself at Burton Albion and pushing hard for a starting spot for Ange Postecoglous World Cup hopefuls
results.secPara: Midfielder Jackson Irvine is making a name for himself at Burton Albion and pushing hard for a starting spot for Ange Postecoglous World Cup hopefuls
results.webTitle: Jackson Irvine: 'It’s an expectation now that Australia should be in the World Cup'

results.firPara: Today a likeable Basti, Effing Tactics Tim and Oliviers and Arsènes excellent adventure
results.secPara: Today a likeable Basti, Effing Tactics Tim and Oliviers and Arsènes excellent adventure
results.webTitle: The Fiver | A consistently cheery demeanour that will have driven Mourinho to madness

results.firPara: Some goals are replayed so often it can blind us to their brilliance. Germanys winner in the 2014 World Cup final is a case in point.
results.secPara: To meet André Schürrles cross in extra time, Mario Götze had sprinted to the top-right corner of the six-yard box. As he cushioned the ball mid-jump with his chest, the attacking midfielder had his back to Sergio Romero in the Argentina goal and momentum threatened to push him over the goalline.
results.webTitle: Mario Götze: the ‘once in a century talent’ who is now fighting to save his career | Philip Oltermann

results.firPara: Thibaut Courtois has insisted he will remain at Chelsea and dismissed speculation that he will move to Real Madrid next season.
results.secPara: The Belgian international goalkeeper has been linked with a move to the European champions if they fail to secure a deal for Manchester Uniteds David De Gea. But, speaking to the Spanish radio station Cadena Sur, Courtois said he was happy at Chelsea and grateful to the Premier League club for the opportunities they had given him.
results.webTitle: Chelsea's Thibaut Courtois shrugs off Real Madrid talk and plans to stay

results.firPara: Our resident cartoonist looks ahead to international fortnight, while taking in Tim Sherwoods potty-mouth, an aerial dogfight over the Hawthorns and more
results.webTitle: David Squires on … Germany v England and other business
